messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] country living and food allergie
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 6/2/00 7:16:54 AM Central Daylight Time, mlb_2boymom@hotmail.com writes:
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 6/2/00 7:16:54 AM Central Daylight Time,
mlb_2boymom@... writes:

<< You ought to
see me watching for the right child to grab the soy milk and the other to
grab the cow's milk in our house! No vacations or visits to other houses
for dinner for awhile! We're just getting the hang of this.
>>
Hi-- I can completely understand where you are coming from... I have to pack
our own snacks if we go anywhere, and eating at someone else's house is
almost out of the question! ~Karen

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] country living and food allergie
messages.msgSnippet: ... Michelle, Please forgive me if I am misunderstanding you but you do realize that Organic only means not grow with pesticides . So unless your children are
messages.messageBody:
--- Michelle Bennett <mlb_2boymom@...> wrote:

>
> Thought I'd add my two cents on the food allergies.
> My3yo has eczema, red
> cheeks and behavior changes caused by allergies to
> milk and wheat! Then my
> 1yo projectile vomits (as in 8 times in one hour!)
> from soy and eggs!!! Do
> you realize how much stuff out there has these
> products? UGH!!! So we have
> become VERY organic lately!

Michelle, Please forgive me if I am misunderstanding
you but you do realize that Organic only means "not
grow with pesticides". So unless your children are
allergic to the pesticides (which we know are bad for
us all) going Organic will not solve the allergy
problem. Have you thought about seeing a Homeopath or
a natural healer who deals with allergies? I believe I
mentioned on this list my DD who through Homeopathy is
asthma free! (it was food allergy related)
Something to think about
best of luck
Jill


The one thing I have
> learned is that I can
> trace 3 of the 4 allergies back to my diet when I
> was pregnant with them!!!
> I have also stumbled upon this concept in a few
> books! So, if any of you
> are dealing with food allergies and considering
> having more children, watch
> your diet when you're pregnant. The biggest thing I
> learned was to not eat
> the same foods all the time and not eating only
> craved foods! You ought to
> see me watching for the right child to grab the soy
> milk and the other to
> grab the cow's milk in our house! No vacations or
> visits to other houses
> for dinner for awhile! We're just getting the hang
> of this.
>
